org.rsna.ctp.stdstages.archive

Class FileSource

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.rsna.ctp.stdstages.archive.FileSource
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class FileSource
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    A FileSource that walks a directory tree. It checkpoints its progress, allowing the program to stop and start without the FileSource losing its place. It is designed to walk through the directory tree once. It does not detect changes in the tree which occur in parts of the tree that have already been passed.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • FileSource

        protected FileSource(java.io.File treeRoot)
        Protected class constructor to ensure that the class is instantiated by calls to getInstance, allowing it to be deserialized from a checkpoint if one exists.
        Parameters:
        treeRoot - the root of the tree to be walked.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static FileSource getInstance(java.io.File treeRoot,
                     java.io.File checkpointDir)
        Get the instance of the FileSource from the checkpoint (if available), or instantiate a new instance if no checkpoint exists.
        Parameters:
        treeRoot - the root of the tree to be walked.
        checkpointDir - the directory in which to write checkpoints, or null if a deserialized instance is not to be obtained.

      • isDone

        public boolean isDone()
        Check whether there is a current Frame. If there is, the FileSource has not yet completed traversing the tree. If there is not, the FileSource is finished, and no more files will be supplied.
        Returns:
        true if the FileSource is done, false otherwise.

      • getFileCount

        public int getFileCount()
        Get the number of files supplied by this FileSource since it was originally instantiated, including any files that were supplied by instances which were loaded by deserializing checkpoints.
        Returns:
        the number of files supplied by this FileSource since it was originally instantiated.

      • getNextFile

        public java.io.File getNextFile()
        Get the next file available in the tree.
        Returns:
        the next file available, or null if no file is available, indicating the end of the arboreal perambulation.
